snippet: The prime minister said payments totaling $2.6 billion, mostly for public sector wages and pensions, would be withheld, putting a burden on Russia.
abstract: Ukrainian Prime Min Arseniy P Yatsenyuk says government will freeze payments it had been sending to parts of eastern Ukraine even after areas fell under control of pro-Russian separatists; move threatens to worsen already dire conditions in country's east while thrusting economic burden of governing on rebel leaders and on Russia, itself teetering on edge of recession.
lead_paragraph: The prime minister said payments totaling $2.6 billion, mostly for public sector wages and pensions, would be withheld, putting a burden on Russia.

headline.main: Ukraine to Freeze Payments in Separatist Areas
headline.print_headline: Ukraine to Freeze Payments in Separatist Areas
